question: You’re really busy at work and a colleague is telling you their life story and personal woes. You:

extrovert: Listen, but with only with half an ear
Interrupt and explain that you are really busy at the moment
introvert: Don’t dare to interrupt them
Think it’s more important to give them some of your time; work can wait

question: You’ve been sitting in the doctor’s waiting room for more than 25 minutes. You:

extrovert: Explain to other equally impatient people in the room that the doctor is always running late
Complain in a loud voice, while tapping your foot impatiently
introvert: Look at your watch every two minutes
Bubble with inner anger, but keep quiet

question: You’re having an animated discussion with a colleague regarding a project that you’re in charge of. You:

extrovert: Defend your own point of view, tooth and nail
Continuously interrupt your colleague
introvert: Don’t dare contradict them
Think that they are obviously right

question: You are taking part in a guided tour of a museum. You:

extrovert: Are right up the front, adding your own comments in a loud voice
Make sure that everyone is able to hear properly
introvert: Are a bit too far towards the back so don’t really hear what the guide is saying
Follow the group without question

question: During dinner parties at your home, you have a hard time with people who:

extrovert: Talk privately between themselves
Always drag the conversation back to themselves
introvert: Hang around you all evening
Ask you to tell a story in front of everyone else

question: You crack a joke at work, but nobody seems to have noticed. You:

extrovert: Keep telling it until they pay attention
Try again a bit later with one of your colleagues
introvert: Think it’s for the best — it was a lame joke anyway
Wait to share it with your friends after work

question: This morning, your agenda seems to be free. You:

extrovert: Question your colleagues about a project that’s been worrying you
Pick up the phone and start filling up your agenda with meetings
introvert: Know that somebody will find a reason to come and bother you
Heave a sigh of relief and look forward to a day without stress

question: During dinner, the discussion moves to a subject about which you know nothing at all. You:

extrovert: Ask lots of questions to learn more about it
Change the subject of discussion
introvert: Don’t dare show that you don’t know anything about the subject
Barely follow the discussion

question: You’re out with a group of friends and there’s a person who’s quite shy and doesn’t talk much. You:

extrovert: Go and have a chat with them
Shoot some friendly smiles in their direction
introvert: Notice that they’re alone, but don’t go over to talk with them
Hardly notice them at all

question: At work, somebody asks for your help for the hundredth time. You:

extrovert: Ask them, please, to find somebody else for a change
Loudly make it known that you’re annoyed
introvert: Give them a hand, as usual
Accept — you’re known for being helpful

question: You’ve been see a movie with your family and the reviews are mixed. You:

extrovert: State your point of view with enthusiasm
Try to bring the others round to your point of view
introvert: Don’t share your point of view with anyone
Didn’t like the film, but keep your views to yourself when asked

question: A friend arrives late for your meeting. You:

extrovert: Tell them, ‘You’re too much! Have you seen the time?’
Make a scene in front of everyone
introvert: Say, ‘It’s not a problem,’ even if that’s not what you really think
Give them a filthy look and sulk for the rest of the evening

question: You can’t find your car keys. You:

extrovert: Panic and search madly without asking anyone for help
Accuse those around you for misplacing them
introvert: Grumble without telling your family why you’re in a bad mood
Don’t want anyone to find out, so you take the bus instead

question: It’s time for your annual appraisal with your boss. You:

extrovert: Look forward to hearing what your boss thinks about you and expects from you
Go along unprepared as you are confident and like improvising
introvert: Go with great hesitation as these sessions are torture for you
Rehearse ad nauseam the arguments and ideas that you’ve prepared for the meeting
